meanings.definition: To stare defiantly or boldly at someone until they look away.
meanings.sent1: She tried to outstare the bully in the playground.
meanings.sent2: He managed to outstare his opponent in the staring contest.
meanings.sent3: The cat attempted to outstare the mouse, but the mouse didn't flinch.
meanings.sent4: The intense gaze of the painting seemed to outstare anyone who looked at it.
meanings.sent5: Her eyes were so piercing that she could easily outstare anyone in a staring match.

meanings.definition: To defeat or overcome someone by staring at them intensely.
meanings.sent1: The hypnotist was able to outstare his subject and put them in a trance.
meanings.sent2: The evil queen's magical mirror could outstare anyone who dared to challenge her beauty.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's ability to outstare villains was his secret weapon.
meanings.sent4: The intense stare of the dragon could outstare even the bravest knight.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly figure seemed to outstare anyone who dared to look into its eyes.
